name: Project
title: Google
Cloud
ResourceManager
Project
description:
Project

Project is a high-level Google Cloud Platform entity. It is a container for ACLs, APIs, AppEngine Apps, VMs, and other Google Cloud Platform resources.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/resource_manager"

resource_manager = Google::Cloud::ResourceManager.new
project = resource_manager.project "tokyo-rain-123"
project.update do |p|
  p.name = "My Project"
  p.labels["env"] = "production"
end

methods.name: project_id
title: Google
Cloud
ResourceManager
Project#project_id
methods.description: The unique, user-assigned ID of the project. It must be 6 to 30 lowercase letters, digits, or hyphens. It must start with a letter. Trailing hyphens are prohibited. e.g. tokyo-rain-123

methods.name: project_number
title: Google
Cloud
ResourceManager
Project#project_number
methods.description: The number uniquely identifying the project. e.g. 415104041262

methods.name: name=
title: Google
Cloud
ResourceManager
Project#name=
methods.description:
Updates the user-assigned name of the project. This field is optional and can remain unset.

Allowed characters are: lowercase and uppercase letters, numbers, hyphen, single-quote, double-quote, space, and exclamation point.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/resource_manager"

resource_manager = Google::Cloud::ResourceManager.new
project = resource_manager.project "tokyo-rain-123"
project.name = "My Project"

methods.name: labels
title: Google
Cloud
ResourceManager
Project#labels
methods.description:
The labels associated with this project.

Label keys must be between 1 and 63 characters long and must conform to the regular expression [a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])?.

Label values must be between 0 and 63 characters long and must conform to the regular expression ([a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])?)?.

No more than 256 labels can be associated with a given resource. (Hash)

examples.caption: Labels are read-only and cannot be changed:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/resource_manager"

resource_manager = Google::Cloud::ResourceManager.new
project = resource_manager.project "tokyo-rain-123"
project.labels["env"] # read-only

examples.caption: Labels can be updated by passing a block, or with #labels=:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/resource_manager"

resource_manager = Google::Cloud::ResourceManager.new
project = resource_manager.project "tokyo-rain-123"
project.labels do |labels|
  labels["env"] = "production"
end

methods.name: labels=
title: Google
Cloud
ResourceManager
Project#labels=
methods.description:
Updates the labels associated with this project.

Label keys must be between 1 and 63 characters long and must conform to the regular expression [a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])?.

Label values must be between 0 and 63 characters long and must conform to the regular expression ([a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])?)?.

No more than 256 labels can be associated with a given resource. (Hash)

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/resource_manager"

resource_manager = Google::Cloud::ResourceManager.new
project = resource_manager.project "tokyo-rain-123"
project.labels = { "env" => "production" }

methods.name: created_at
title: Google
Cloud
ResourceManager
Project#created_at
methods.description: The time that this project was created.

methods.name: state
title: Google
Cloud
ResourceManager
Project#state
methods.description:
The project lifecycle state.

Possible values are:

  • ACTIVE - The normal and active state.
  • DELETE_REQUESTED - The project has been marked for deletion by the user (by invoking ##delete) or by the system (Google Cloud Platform). This can generally be reversed by invoking #undelete.
  • DELETE_IN_PROGRESS - The process of deleting the project has begun. Reversing the deletion is no longer possible.
  • LIFECYCLE_STATE_UNSPECIFIED - Unspecified state. This is only used/useful for distinguishing unset values.

methods.name: update
title: Google
Cloud
ResourceManager
Project#update
methods.description: Updates the project in a single API call. See Project::Updater

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/resource_manager"

resource_manager = Google::Cloud::ResourceManager.new
project = resource_manager.project "tokyo-rain-123"
project.update do |p|
  p.name = "My Project"
  p.labels["env"] = "production"
end

params.name: yield
params.description: a block yielding a project delegate

params.name: yield.project
params.description:
the delegate object for
updating the project

methods.name: reload!
title: Google
Cloud
ResourceManager
Project#reload!
methods.description: Reloads the project (with updated state) from the Google Cloud Resource Manager service.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/resource_manager"

resource_manager = Google::Cloud::ResourceManager.new
project = resource_manager.project "tokyo-rain-123"
project.reload!

methods.name: delete
title: Google
Cloud
ResourceManager
Project#delete
methods.description:
Marks the project for deletion. This method will only affect the project if the following criteria are met:

  • The project does not have a billing account associated with it.
  • The project has a lifecycle state of ACTIVE.
  • This method changes the projectâ€™s lifecycle state from ACTIVE to DELETE_REQUESTED. The deletion starts at an unspecified time, at which point the lifecycle state changes to DELETE_IN_PROGRESS.

Until the deletion completes, you can check the lifecycle state by calling #reload!, or by retrieving the project with Manager#project. The project remains visible to Manager#project and Manager#projects, but cannot be updated.

After the deletion completes, the project is not retrievable by the Manager#project and Manager#projects methods.

The caller must have modify permissions for this project.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/resource_manager"

resource_manager = Google::Cloud::ResourceManager.new
project = resource_manager.project "tokyo-rain-123"
project.active? #=> true
project.delete
project.active? #=> false
project.delete_requested? #=> true

methods.name: undelete
title: Google
Cloud
ResourceManager
Project#undelete
methods.description:
Restores the project. You can only use this method for a project that has a lifecycle state of DELETE_REQUESTED. After deletion starts, as indicated by a lifecycle state of DELETE_IN_PROGRESS, the project cannot be restored.

The caller must have modify permissions for this project.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/resource_manager"

resource_manager = Google::Cloud::ResourceManager.new
project = resource_manager.project "tokyo-rain-123"
project.delete_requested? #=> true
project.undelete
project.delete_requested? #=> false
project.active? #=> true

methods.name: policy
title: Google
Cloud
ResourceManager
Project#policy
methods.description: Gets and updates the Cloud IAM access control policy for this project.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/resource_manager"

resource_manager = Google::Cloud::ResourceManager.new
project = resource_manager.project "tokyo-rain-123"

policy = project.policy

examples.caption: Update the policy by passing a block:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/resource_manager"

resource_manager = Google::Cloud::ResourceManager.new
project = resource_manager.project "tokyo-rain-123"

project.policy do |p|
  p.add "roles/owner", "user:owner@example.com"
end

params.name: yield
params.description:
A block for updating the policy. The latest policy
will be read from the service and passed to the block. After the
block completes, the modified policy will be written to the service.

params.name: yield.policy
params.description:
the current Cloud IAM Policy for this
project

returns.description: the current Cloud IAM Policy for this project

methods.name: update_policy
title: Google
Cloud
ResourceManager
Project#update_policy
methods.description:
Updates the Cloud IAM access control policy for this project. The policy should be read from #policy. See Google::Cloud::ResourceManager::Policy for an explanation of the policy etag property and how to modify policies.

You can also update the policy by passing a block to #policy, which will call this method internally after the block completes.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/resource_manager"

resource_manager = Google::Cloud::ResourceManager.new
project = resource_manager.project "tokyo-rain-123"

policy = project.policy # API call

policy.add "roles/owner", "user:owner@example.com"

project.update_policy policy # API call

params.name: new_policy
params.description:
a new or modified Cloud IAM Policy for this
project

returns.description: the policy returned by the API update operation

methods.name: test_permissions
title: Google
Cloud
ResourceManager
Project#test_permissions
methods.description: Tests the specified permissions against the Cloud IAM access control policy.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/resource_manager"

resource_manager = Google::Cloud::ResourceManager.new
project = resource_manager.project "tokyo-rain-123"
perms = project.test_permissions "resourcemanager.projects.get",
                                 "resourcemanager.projects.delete"
perms.include? "resourcemanager.projects.get"    #=> true
perms.include? "resourcemanager.projects.delete" #=> false

params.name: permissions
params.description: The set of permissions to check access for. Permissions with wildcards (such as * or storage.*) are not allowed.
